Discussion Topic

Professionals can help parents by reinforcing the basic communication needs of children. Remind parents that the best way to foster their child’s language and communication skills is through everyday interaction.

Video / Discussion

Watch “Keep Talking” from the Talaris Everyday Moments Count DVD.

Following the video, ask the parents what the biggest reasons are that parents may not engage their children in conversation?

Possible Responses:

  • Parents aren't at home spending time with their children.
  • Parents have a children-should-be-seen-and-not-heard approach.
  • Parents depend on media such as videos or computer games to teach language skills.

    • Follow-up

    After listing the possible reasons why parents don’t engage their children in conversation, follow-up by asking them for suggestions of what they could do to overcome the listed obstacles. Some parents may be more willing to put these suggestions into practice if they come up with them on their own and feel that the solutions are doable. Guide them towards researched-based solutions.
